declarations.name: ino-autocomplete.tsx
declarations.description:
A component that acts similar to the native `datalist` feature of the `<input>` element.

In contrast to other components, this one is stateful, which means that it contains its own state and is therefore less
flexible to some extent.

This component handles the following tasks:

* Management of the `value` property of the `<ino-input>` element
* management of showing and hiding the different options filtered on the basis of the input
* Keyboard navigation on the options

The options are filtered by `.includes(...)`, ignoring upper and lower case.

attributes.name: debounce-timeout
attributes.description: Timeout of the debouncing mechanism used when filtering the options.

attributes.name: no-options-text
attributes.description: Text to display when there are no options found.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the autocomplete

events.name: valueChange
events.description:
Emits in three ways:

1. Clicking on an option
2. Pressing `Enter` while an option is selected
3. Entering a valid value and blurring the input element

Contains one of the texts provided by the `<ino-options>`s.

slots.name: default
slots.description: A list of `<ino-option>` elements as options

slots.name: input
slots.description: An `<ino-input>` element that will be controlled by this component

cssProperties.name: --ino-autocomplete-list-max-height
cssProperties.description: max height of option list

declarations.name: ino-button.tsx
declarations.description: A button component with different styles and icon capability.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Sets the autofocus for this element.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.
Possible values: `primary` (default),  `secondary`, `grey`, `white`.
`white` and `grey` can only be used in combination with the `outline` fill-option!

attributes.name: dense
attributes.description: Makes the button text and container slightly smaller.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: edge-mirrored
attributes.description: Styles the button to have the edge on the top-right instead of the top-left

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
The fill type of this element.
Possible values: `solid` (default), `outline`, `inverse`.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: The form id this element origins to.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Shows an infinite loading spinner and prevents further clicks.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of this form.

Can either be `button`, `submit` or `reset`.

slots.name: icon-leading
slots.description: For the icon to be prepended

slots.name: icon-trailing
slots.description: For the icon to be appended

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-primary
cssProperties.description: Color of the primary button

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-primary-contrast
cssProperties.description: Contrast color of the primary button. Will be used for the text color

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-primary-dark
cssProperties.description: Dark color of the primary button. Will be used for the active effect

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-primary-light
cssProperties.description: Light color of the primary button. Will be used for the hover effect

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-primary-shadow-dark
cssProperties.description: Shadow color of the primary button used on active

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-primary-shadow-light
cssProperties.description: Shadow color of the primary button used on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-secondary
cssProperties.description: Color of the primary button

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-secondary-contrast
cssProperties.description: Contrast color of the secondary button. Will be used for the text color

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-secondary-dark
cssProperties.description: Dark color of the secondary button. Will be used for the active effect

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-secondary-light
cssProperties.description: Light color of the secondary button. Will be used for the hover effect

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-secondary-shadow-dark
cssProperties.description: Shadow color of the secondary button used on active

cssProperties.name: --ino-button-color-secondary-shadow-light
cssProperties.description: Shadow color of the secondary button used on hover

declarations.name: ino-card.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-card is a flexible and extensible component. It features a header, content, and footer slot that can be used to
fully customize the appearance of the card.

attributes.name: disable-elevation
attributes.description: Disables the hover effect if true

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Selects the card and displays a check mark icon on top of the card

slots.name: footer
slots.description: For the element to be placed in the card footer

slots.name: header
slots.description: For the element to be placed in the card header

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-background-color
cssProperties.description: background color of the card

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-background-color--active
cssProperties.description: background color of the card if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-background-color--focus
cssProperties.description: background color of the card on focus

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-background-color--hover
cssProperties.description: background color of the card on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-border-color
cssProperties.description: border color of the card

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-border-thickness
cssProperties.description: thickness of the border

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-checkmark-background-color
cssProperties.description: background color of the check mark

cssProperties.name: --ino-card-checkmark-color
cssProperties.description: check mark color

declarations.name: ino-carousel.tsx
declarations.description:
The `ino-carousel` component works in combination with the `ino-carousel-slide` component
and can be used to display an array of images as a slide show. What is more,
it also features an autoplay property that allows the slides to be changed automatically.
Lastly, using the css variables described at the bottom of the page, you can easily customize
the dimensions of the component as well as the duration of the slide transition.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: Enables the slide animation

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: Enables autoplay which causes slides to be changed automatically

attributes.name: hide-buttons
attributes.description: Hides the arrow buttons

attributes.name: infinite
attributes.description: Restarts playback from the first slide upon reaching the last slide

attributes.name: intermission
attributes.description: Sets the intermission between two slides (Unit: ms)

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: Enables reverse playback of the slides

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Optional group value to manually manage the displayed slide

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-animation-duration
cssProperties.description: sets the duration of the slide animation

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-height
cssProperties.description: sets the height of the carousel component

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-icon-color
cssProperties.description: sets the color of the navigation buttons

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-width
cssProperties.description: sets the width of the carousel component

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Link to the image

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the slide

declarations.name: ino-checkbox.tsx
declarations.description: A checkbox that allows the user to select one or more items from a set of options.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Marks this element as checked. (**unmanaged**)

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: Marks this element as indeterminate (**unmanaged**)

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description:
Styles the checkbox as a selection variant that has a larger radius.
While checkboxes are mainly used in lists, the selection should be used as a single, independent UI element.
The indeterminate state is not supported here.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element.

events.name: checkedChange
events.description: Emits when the user clicks on the checkbox to change the checked state. Contains the status in `event.detail`.

cssProperties.name: --checkbox-container-color-unchecked
cssProperties.description: color of the checkbox container if unchecked

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-background-color-disabled
cssProperties.description: color of the checkbox background if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-checkmark-color
cssProperties.description: primary color of the check mark

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-checkmark-color-disabled
cssProperties.description: color of the check mark if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-color
cssProperties.description: primary color of the checkbox

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-color-active
cssProperties.description: color of the checkbox if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-color-hover
cssProperties.description: color of the checkbox on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-checkbox-text-color-disabled
cssProperties.description: color of the checkbox text if disabled

declarations.name: ino-chip.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-chip component displays the provided content and icon as a chip.

> An ino-chip component must **always** belong to a `ino-chip-set` component.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: The fill type of this element.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Prepends an icon to the chip label.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label of this chip (**required**).

attributes.name: removable
attributes.description:
Adds a close icon on the right side of this chip.

If applied, emits the `removeChip` event.

attributes.name: selectable
attributes.description: Adds a checkmark if the icon is selected.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Marks this element as selected.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value of this chip.

**Required** for chips as part of sets of type `filter` or `choice`.

events.name: removeChip
events.description:
Event that emits as soon as the user removes this chip.

Listen to this event to hide or destroy this chip.
The event only emits if the property `removable` is true.

slots.name: icon-leading
slots.description: For the icon to be prepended

slots.name: icon-trailing
slots.description: For the icon to be appended - disables the `removable` property

declarations.name: ino-chip-set.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-chip-set is a wrapper component for `ino-chip` components. It enables the user to filter content,
select a choice, or trigger an action.

> See the `ino-chip` documentation for more details about a single instance of a chip.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of this chip set that indicates its behavior.

`choice`: Single selection from a set of options
`filter`: Multiple selection from a set of options
`input`: Enable user input by converting text into chips

events.name: updateChipSet
events.description:
Event that emits when the value of this element changes.

Only applicable if `inoType` is `choice` or `filter`.

declarations.name: ino-control-item.tsx
declarations.description:
A list item component that displays a single instance of choice in a list or menu with a control element (radio-button or checkbox). It functions as a wrapper around the material [list item](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-list/) capabilities.

This component is used as child of `ino-list` and `ino-menu` components.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description:
Styles the row in an activated style.

In contrast to `selected`, use this for only one item
and to mark it as permanently activated.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Marks this element as checked. (**unmanaged**)

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description:
Marks this element as indeterminate (**unmanaged**)
Checkbox only

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: The type of control element

attributes.name: secondary-text
attributes.description:
Sets the secondary text of this list item.

Requires `two-lines` on the parent `ino-list` element.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Styles the row in a selected style.

In contrast to `activated`, use this option to select one
or multiple items that are likely to change soon.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The primary text of this list item (required).

attributes.name: trailing
attributes.description: Places the checkbox at the end of the item

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element.

events.name: checkedChange
events.description: Emits when the user clicks on the checkbox or the list item to change the checked state. Contains the status in `event.detail`.

declarations.name: ino-datepicker.tsx
declarations.description: A datepicker is a ui component to select dates and times. It behaves like a native `input` but uses the [flatpickr](https://github.com/flatpickr/flatpickr) library for a better ui experience.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Autofocuses this element.

attributes.name: date-format
attributes.description:
A string to change the date format.
Possible values are listed [here](https://flatpickr.js.org/formatting/).
The default value is `d-m-Y` which accepts values like `01-01-2019`.

attributes.name: default-date
attributes.description:
A string/array containing the initial date of the datepicker overlay. If you're using `inoRange = true` provide an array.
If a `value` is given, this will be ignored.

attributes.name: default-hour
attributes.description:
A number containing the initial hour in the date-time picker overlay.
If a `value` is given, this will be ignored.

attributes.name: default-minute
attributes.description:
A number containing the initial minute in the date-time picker overlay.
If a `value` is given, this will be ignored.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description:
Displays the datepicker as invalid if set to true.
If the property is not set or set to false,
the validation is handled by the default validation.

attributes.name: helper
attributes.description: The helper text.

attributes.name: helper-persistent
attributes.description: Displays the helper permanently.

attributes.name: helper-validation
attributes.description: Styles the helper text as a validation message.

attributes.name: hour-step
attributes.description:
Adjusts the step for the hour input (incl. scrolling)
Default is 1

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Defines the label for this element.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum date that a user can pick to (inclusive).

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum date that a user can start picking from (inclusive).

attributes.name: minute-step
attributes.description:
Adjusts the step for the minute input (incl. scrolling)
Default is 5

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input name of this element.

attributes.name: outline
attributes.description: Styles the datepicker as outlined element.

attributes.name: range
attributes.description:
If true, enables the user to choose two dates as an interval.
Only works with `type="date"`

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Marks this element as required.

attributes.name: show-label-hint
attributes.description:
If true, an *optional* message is displayed if not required,
otherwise a * marker is displayed if required

attributes.name: twelve-hour-time
attributes.description: If true, displays time picker in 12 hour mode with AM/PM selection.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Selects the correct picker corresponding to the given type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The currently selected date shown in the input field **unmanaged**. The given value
will not be formatted as date.

events.name: valueChange
events.description:
Emits when the value of the datepicker changes.
The value can be found in `event.detail`

declarations.name: ino-dialog.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-dialog component displays a modal window that can be used to display additional information or notify the user.
It is based on the mdc-drawer and is composed of a header, content, and footer section which are fully customizable.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Opens the dialog if set to true

events.name: openChange
events.description: Emits an event upon opening or closing the dialog

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-background-color
cssProperties.description: background color of the dialog

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-border
cssProperties.description: border shorthand of the dialog

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-border-radius
cssProperties.description: border-radius of the dialog

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-box-shadow
cssProperties.description: box-shadow of the dialog

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-content-height
cssProperties.description: height of the content section

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-footer-height
cssProperties.description: height of the footer section

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-header-height
cssProperties.description: height of the header section

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-height
cssProperties.description: height of the dialog

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-overlay-background-color
cssProperties.description: background color of the overlay

cssProperties.name: --ino-dialog-width
cssProperties.description: width of the dialog

declarations.name: ino-fab.tsx
declarations.description:
A floating action button represents the primary action in an application. [Floating Action Button](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-fab) component.
It appears in front of all screen content, typically as a circular shape with an icon in its center.

FABs come in three types: regular, mini, and extended.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the button.

attributes.name: edge-position
attributes.description: The position of the edge.

attributes.name: extended
attributes.description: Optional, modifies the FAB to wider size which includes a text label.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Adds an icon to the Fab.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Optional, for the text label. Applicable only for Extended FAB.

attributes.name: mini
attributes.description: Optional, modifies the FAB to a smaller size

attributes.name: tooltip-placement
attributes.description:
The placement of the tooltip which will be displayed when the button is not extended.
Use `none`, if you don't want a tooltip to be displayed.

slots.name: icon-leading
slots.description: For the icon to be prepended

cssProperties.name: --fab-background-color
cssProperties.description: Background color

cssProperties.name: --fab-background-color-active
cssProperties.description: Background color if active

cssProperties.name: --fab-background-color-disabled
cssProperties.description: Background color if disabled

cssProperties.name: --fab-background-color-hover
cssProperties.description: Background color on hover

cssProperties.name: --fab-color-disabled
cssProperties.description: Text color if disabled

cssProperties.name: --fab-icon-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the slotted icon

cssProperties.name: --fab-icon-color-disabled
cssProperties.description: Color of the slotted icon if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-fab-color
cssProperties.description: Text color

declarations.name: ino-fab-set.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-fab-set component serves as a container for multiple fab buttons. It contains actions related to the main fab
button. Upon interacting with the fab button, a FAB-Set can display three to six related actions in the form of a speed
dial.

attributes.name: dial-direction
attributes.description:
The direction of the speed dial.
Possible values: `top` (default), `bottom`, `right`, `left`.

attributes.name: left-right-location
attributes.description:
The side where the Fab is displayed.
Possible values: `right`, `left` (default).

attributes.name: open-dial
attributes.description: Opens the dial (**uncontrolled**)

attributes.name: top-bottom-location
attributes.description:
The side where the Fab is displayed.
Possible values: `top`, `bottom` (default).

declarations.name: ino-form-row.tsx
declarations.description: A component that styles a form element as a row with a leading label.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label for this form row which describes the form element.

attributes.name: mandatory
attributes.description:
An indicator which marks the contents of the form row as mandatory.
If you use this make sure you also check for the values in your application logic.

declarations.name: ino-header.tsx
declarations.description: A header component with a separator.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The text of this header

cssProperties.name: --ino-header-box-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the header box

cssProperties.name: --ino-header-color
cssProperties.description: Text color of the header

declarations.name: ino-icon.tsx
declarations.description: This component is based on the ionicons (https://github.com/ionic-team/ionicons)

attributes.name: clickable
attributes.description: Makes the icon clickable and allows to listen to the `clickEl` event.

attributes.name: color-secondary
attributes.description: Colors the icon in the global secondary color

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: The name of the icon of this element or an URL.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Specifies the exact `src` of an SVG file to use.

attributes.name: svg-title
attributes.description: Sets a meaningful svg title for assistive technologies.

events.name: clickEl
events.description:
Event that emits as soon as the user clicks on the icon.
The event only emits if the property `inoClickable` is true.

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-color-primary
cssProperties.description: Primary (default) color of the icon

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-color-secondary
cssProperties.description: Secondary color of the icon

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-height
cssProperties.description: Height of the icon

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-width
cssProperties.description: Width of the icon

declarations.name: ino-icon-button.tsx
declarations.description: A rounded button component that contains an icon. It functions as a wrapper around the material [icon-button](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-icon-button) component.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description:
Marks the icon button as activated.

Useful in cases where an external state controls the icon button activation.
Makes the component **managed**.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Sets the autofocus for this element.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.
Possible values: `primary` (default),  `secondary`,
`success`, `warning`, `error`, `light`, `dark`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: filled
attributes.description:
Styles this element as filled icon button
with the `ino-color-scheme` as background color.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: The name of the icon of this element.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of this form.

Can either be `button`, `submit` or `reset`.

events.name: clickEl
events.description:
Event that emits as soon as the user clicks on the icon.
The event only emits if the property `clickable` is true.

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-button-background-active-color
cssProperties.description: base color of the active background

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-button-background-color
cssProperties.description: default color of the background

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-button-icon-active-color
cssProperties.description: color of the active icon itself

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-button-icon-color
cssProperties.description: default color of the icon itself

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-button-icon-size
cssProperties.description: size of the icon itself

cssProperties.name: --ino-icon-button-size
cssProperties.description: size of the entire button

declarations.name: ino-img.tsx
declarations.description: An image component with different styles that reserves a predefined space to avoid jumping contents.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: The alternative text of this image.

attributes.name: decoding
attributes.description:
The decoding method of the native html input element.
Can either be `async`, `auto` or `sync`.

attributes.name: fallback-icon
attributes.description: Icon used for fallback image if image can not be loaded

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The fixed height of this image.

attributes.name: img-list-item
attributes.description: Indicates that the image is a part of an image list component

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
Sets the label of the image. Note: Only works if image is part of
an ino-img-list component.

attributes.name: ratio-height
attributes.description:
The ratio height for this image (default = 1).
Use this attribute together with `ratio-width` to reserve a
space for the image during rendering and to prevent jumping contents.

attributes.name: ratio-width
attributes.description:
The ratio width of this image (default = 1).
Use this attribute together with `ratio-height` to reserve a
space for the image during rendering and to prevent jumping contents.

attributes.name: rounded
attributes.description: If true, styles the image with rounded borders.

attributes.name: sizes
attributes.description:
A set of rules to specify the usage of images sources that are
defined in the `srcset` attribute.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The source of this image element.

attributes.name: srcset
attributes.description: A set of sources of this image for different viewports or devices.

attributes.name: usemap
attributes.description: An ID referencing to a defined map element for this image.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The fixed of the image.

declarations.name: ino-img-list.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-img-list component is used in combination with the ino-img component to display an array of images
in a grid-like format. It is based on the mdc-image-list component.

attributes.name: enclose-label
attributes.description: Encapsulates the label of all img-list-items within the image

attributes.name: masonry
attributes.description:
Enables the masonry image list variant, which allows the images to
be any combination of aspect ratios.

cssProperties.name: --ino-img-list-cols
cssProperties.description: sets the number of columns

declarations.name: ino-input.tsx
declarations.description:
An input component with styles. It functions as a wrapper around the material [textfield](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-textfield) component.

Use this element for **simple types** like `text`, `password`, `number` or `email`. For more complex types, there are elements like a [Radio Button](../ino-radio), a [Checkbox](../ino-checkbox), a [Datepicker](../ino-datepicker) and many more.

attributes.name: auto-focus
attributes.description: The autofocus of this element.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: The autocomplete property of this element.

attributes.name: data-list
attributes.description: The id of the datalist child

attributes.name: decimal-places
attributes.description: The number of decimal places. Only works on 'text' type input.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description:
Displays the input field as invalid if set to true.
If the property is not set or set to false, the validation is handled by the `pattern` property.
This functionality might be useful if the input validation is (additionally) handled by the backend.

attributes.name: helper
attributes.description: The optional helper text.

attributes.name: helper-character-counter
attributes.description:
Displays the number of characters. The maxlength-property must be set.
This helper text will be displayed persistently.

attributes.name: helper-persistent
attributes.description: Displays the helper permanently.

attributes.name: helper-validation
attributes.description: Styles the helper text as a validation message.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The optional floating label of this input field.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The max value of this element.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Limits the number of possible characters to the given number

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The min value of this element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: outline
attributes.description: Styles the input field as outlined element.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: The validation pattern of this element.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The placeholder of this element.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Marks this element as required.

attributes.name: show-label-hint
attributes.description:
If true, an *optional* message is displayed if not required,
otherwise a * marker is displayed if required

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of this element.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: The step value of this element. Use `any` for decimal numbers

attributes.name: thousands-separator
attributes.description: Shows a dot as a thousands separator. Only works on 'text' type input.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of this element (default = text).

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: Displays the given unit at the end of the input field.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element. (**unmanaged**)

events.name: inoBlur
events.description: Emits when the input field is blurred and validates email input

events.name: inoFocus
events.description: Emits when the input field is focused

events.name: valueChange
events.description:
Emits when the user types something in.
Contains typed input in `event.detail`

slots.name: icon-leading
slots.description: For the icon to be prepended

slots.name: icon-trailing
slots.description: For the icon to be appended

cssProperties.name: --ino-input-caret-color
cssProperties.description: color of the caret

cssProperties.name: --ino-input-icon-color
cssProperties.description: icon color

cssProperties.name: --ino-input-label-color
cssProperties.description: color of the label

cssProperties.name: --ino-input-line-color
cssProperties.description: line color

declarations.name: ino-input-file.tsx
declarations.description:
An input component for files. It functions as a wrapper around the native input capabilities having the [`type="file"`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/file).

This component replaces the native behaviour with a custom `ino-button` with logic.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: The types of files accepted by the server.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The autofocus of this element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: drag-and-drop
attributes.description: Enables drag-and-drop file input

attributes.name: drag-and-drop-secondary-text
attributes.description: Sets the secondary text of the drag and drop window

attributes.name: drag-and-drop-text
attributes.description: Sets the primary text of the drag and drop window

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Sets the label of the select files button.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Indicates whether the user can enter one or more values.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this input field.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Marks this element as required.

events.name: changeFile
events.description: Emits when the value changes.

cssProperties.name: --ino-input-file-box-height
cssProperties.description: Height of the drag and drop window

cssProperties.name: --ino-input-file-box-width
cssProperties.description: Width of the drag and drop window

declarations.name: ino-label.tsx
declarations.description:
This is an internally used component for various sorts of inputs like `ino-input`, `ino-select` and `ino-textarea`. It is used to display the label for each respective component.

```html
<ino-label
  outline="<boolean>"
  label="<string>"
  required="<boolean>"
  disabled="<boolean>"
>
</ino-label>
```

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Colors the label in an light grey to indicate the disabled status for this element

attributes.name: outline
attributes.description: Styles the label in an outlined style

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Appends * to the label to make it appear as an required input in a form

attributes.name: show-hint
attributes.description:
Shows a "optional" message, when not `required`;
Shows a * mark, when `required`

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The text of the label itself

declarations.name: ino-list.tsx
declarations.description:
A component that displays a list of choices. It functions as a wrapper around the material [list](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-list/) component.

This component is a composer to configure and wrap `list-item`s, `list-divider`s, `control-item`s and `nav-item`s.

attributes.name: avatar
attributes.description:
Configures the leading tiles of each row to display images instead of icons.
This will make the graphics of the list items larger.

attributes.name: dense
attributes.description: Styles the list more dense, making it appear more compact.

attributes.name: two-lines
attributes.description: Marks this element as list with items having two lines.

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-border-radius
cssProperties.description: Border radius of the list container, also effects the first and last list item

declarations.name: ino-list-divider.tsx
declarations.description:
A list divider component that either divides two lists or list items. It functions as a wrapper around the material [list divider](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-divider/) capabilities.

This component is used as child of `ino-list` and `ino-menu` components.

attributes.name: between-lists
attributes.description:
Marks the divider as a separator between two `ino-list`
instead of `ino-list-item` elements.

attributes.name: inset
attributes.description:
Increases leading margin to match leading column in `ino-list-item`.

Only applicable if `betweenList` is `false`.

attributes.name: padded
attributes.description:
Increases margin on each side of the divider to match meta content
in `ino-list-item`.

Only applicable if `betweenList` is `false`.

declarations.name: ino-list-item.tsx
declarations.description:
A list item component that displays a single instance of choice in a list or menu. It functions as a wrapper around the material [list item](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-list/) capabilities.

This component is used as child of `ino-list` and `ino-menu` components.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description:
Styles the row in an activated style.

In contrast to `selected`, use this for only one item
and to mark it as permantently activated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Styles the row in a disabled style.

attributes.name: secondary-text
attributes.description:
Sets the secondary text of this list item.

Requires `two-lines` on the parent `ino-list` element.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Styles the row in a selected style.

In contrast to `activated`, use this option to select one
or multiple items that are likely to change soon.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The primary text of this list item.

events.name: clickEl
events.description:
Emits when the list item is clicked or
the enter/space key if pressed while the item is in focus.
Contains the element itself in `event.detail`

slots.name: leading
slots.description: For the element to be prepended

slots.name: secondary
slots.description: For the secondary text element in a two-lined list

slots.name: trailing
slots.description: For the element to be appended

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-deselected-background-color
cssProperties.description: Background color of a deselected list item

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-deselected-background-color-active
cssProperties.description: Background color of a deselected list item if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-deselected-background-color-focus
cssProperties.description: Background color of a deselected list item if focused

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-deselected-background-color-hover
cssProperties.description: Background color of a deselected list item on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-deselected-color
cssProperties.description: Text color of a deselected list item

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-selected-background-color
cssProperties.description: Background color of a selected list item

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-selected-background-color-active
cssProperties.description: Background color of a selected list item if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-selected-background-color-focus
cssProperties.description: Background color of a selected list item if focused

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-selected-background-color-hover
cssProperties.description: Background color of a selected list item on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-list-item-selected-color
cssProperties.description: Text color of a selected list item

declarations.name: ino-menu.tsx
declarations.description:
A menu component that displays a list of choices on a temporary surface which opens and closes on anchor or item click.
The anchor element is the parent element.

The menu items consist of different variations of the `ino-list-item` component.

If you need a more customizable menu with a different type of elements or functionalities, have a look at the `ino-popover`.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
Determines the position of the opened menu.
Usually, the default value (`auto`) will work just fine.
Use this if the positioning is off for some reason.

declarations.name: ino-nav-drawer.tsx
declarations.description:
A navigation drawer component with different variants, setting up the base layout for your app.
It functions as a wrapper around the material [drawer](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-drawer/) component.

> Note: The navigation drawer works best with `ino-list` and `ino-nav-item`s inside.

attributes.name: anchor
attributes.description:
Side from which the drawer will appear.
Possible values: `left` (default), `right`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Marks this element as open. (**unmanaged**)

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The variant to use for the drawer
Possible values: `docked` (default), `dismissible`, `modal`.

events.name: openChange
events.description: Emits when the user clicks on the drawer toggle icon to change the open state. Contains the status in `event.detail`.

slots.name: app
slots.description: For the application located next to this nav-drawer

slots.name: content
slots.description: For the content of the navigation bar (usually used with `ino-list` and `ino-nav-item`)

slots.name: footer
slots.description: For elements below the content slot

slots.name: header
slots.description: For a custom header on top of the navigation bar

slots.name: logo
slots.description: For the logo on top of the navigation bar (cannot be used with the `header` slot)

slots.name: subtitle
slots.description: For the element just below the logo (cannot be used with the `header` slot)

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-background
cssProperties.description: Background of the drawer.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-height
cssProperties.description: Height of the drawer.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-text-color
cssProperties.description: Color of text inside the drawer.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-timing-function
cssProperties.description: Timing function of the slide animation of the drawer.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-transition-duration
cssProperties.description: Duration of the slide animation of the drawer.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-width-closed
cssProperties.description: Docked variant only! The width of the collapsed drawer.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-drawer-width-open
cssProperties.description: The width of the open drawer.

declarations.name: ino-nav-item.tsx
declarations.description:
A nav item component that displays a single instance of choice in a list or menu. It functions as a wrapper around the material [list item](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-list/) capabilities.

This component is used as child of `ino-list` and `ino-menu` components.

> Note: This component's main use case is within the `ino-nav-drawer`.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description:
Styles the row in an activated style.

Use this for only one item
and to mark it as permanently activated.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Styles the row in a disabled style.

attributes.name: sub-text
attributes.description: The secondary text of this list item used in a two-lined list.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The text of this list item.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-item-background-color
cssProperties.description: Inactive color of the background of one item.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-item-background-color-active
cssProperties.description: Active color of the background of one item.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-item-color
cssProperties.description: Inactive color of icon.

cssProperties.name: --ino-nav-item-color-active
cssProperties.description: Active color of icon.

declarations.name: ino-option.tsx
declarations.description: An option component that can be used to add options to an ino-select component.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the option

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Selects the option

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the option

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-deselected-background-color
cssProperties.description: Background color if deselected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-deselected-background-color-active
cssProperties.description: Background color if active and deselected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-deselected-background-color-focus
cssProperties.description: Background color on focus if deselected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-deselected-background-color-hover
cssProperties.description: Background color on hover if deselected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-selected-background-color
cssProperties.description: Background color if selected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-selected-background-color-active
cssProperties.description: Background color if active and selected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-selected-background-color-focus
cssProperties.description: Background color on focus if selected

cssProperties.name: --ino-option-selected-background-color-hover
cssProperties.description: Background color on hover if selected

declarations.name: ino-option-group.tsx
declarations.description:
A wrapper component to be used for a group of ino-options. This component adds a non-selectable header before the options.

Beyond that, if you encounter problems using React or Vue in conjunction with the `ino-select`, use this component as a wrapper around your `ino-option`. This way the virtual DOM will know when to update the `ino-select` and its children, which may otherwise not work properly if the options are added dynamically while deeply nested in the `ino-select'. For more information refer to [this issue](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues/2259).

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
Label of the group. If not set, this component serves as a wrapper component for dynamically added `ino-options`.
When using react and vue, an issue exists with slots and the virtual DOM. Read more about it [here](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues/2259).

declarations.name: ino-popover.tsx
declarations.description:
A Popover is a dialog which is bound to a specific element and appears next to it. Under the
hood, [tippy.js](https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/) is used.

The Popover
and [Tooltip](https://elements.inovex.de/dist/latest/storybook/?path=/story/notification-ino-tooltip--default-usage)
components are very similar. However, popovers are complex dialogs consisting of several HTML elements, while tooltips
can only display plain text.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
Sets the color scheme of the popup
Valid options include: 'primary', 'secondary', 'light', 'transparent'

attributes.name: controlled
attributes.description: Used to indicate if the popover should be controlled by itself (`false`) or manually by the `visible` property (`true`)

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description:
Displaces the popover away from, or toward, the anchor element in the direction of its placement.
A positive number displaces it further away, while a negative number lets it overlap the anchor.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
The target id the popover belongs to.
If not given, the popover is attached to the element provided in the named slot (`popover-trigger`)
or the parent component if a slot element does not exist.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Use this if you want to interact with the popover content (e.g. button clicks)

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The placement of this popover.
Accepted values: `top(-start, -end)`, `right(-start, -end)`,
`bottom(-start, -end)`, `left(-start, -end)`

attributes.name: trigger

type.text: "click focus mouseenter" | "click focus" | "click mouseenter focus" | "click mouseenter" | "click" | "focus click mouseenter" | "focus click" | "focus mouseenter click" | "focus mouseenter" | "focus" | "mouseenter click focus" | "mouseenter click" | "mouseenter focus click" | "mouseenter focus" | "mouseenter"

attributes.description:
The trigger to show the tooltip - either click, hover or focus.
Multiple triggers are possible by separating them with a space.

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description:
Programmatically show or hide the popover.
Can only be used in controlled mode (see property `controlled`).
Use the `visibleChanged` to sync the popovers' visibility state with yours.

events.name: visibleChanged
events.description:
Emits when the popover wants to show (`true`) or hide (`false`) itself.
This is depended on the `trigger` property.
Use this event in controlled-mode (see `controlled`).

e.g.: `trigger = 'click'` - This events emits with `true`
when the user clicks on the target (slot/`for`/parent-element)
and emits with `false` when the target or the outside is clicked.

slots.name: popover-trigger
slots.description: The target element to attach the triggers to

declarations.name: ino-progress-bar.tsx
declarations.description: The ino-progress-bar is a linear progress bar based on the mdc-linear-progress component.

attributes.name: buffer
attributes.description: Sets the buffer progress

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: Indicates whether the state of the progress bar is indeterminate

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Sets the label of the progress bar

attributes.name: progress
attributes.description:
Sets the progress of the progress bar.
Should always be between 0 and 1

attributes.name: reversed
attributes.description: Reverses the progress bar

cssProperties.name: --progress-bar--bar-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the progress bar

declarations.name: ino-radio.tsx
declarations.description: A radio component that allows the user to select an option from a set of radio-buttons. In order to have a single select functionality, please refer to the `ino-radio-group`-component. This component functions as a wrapper around the material [radio](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-radio) component.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description:
Initially marks this element as checked.
If another ino-radio element in the same group receives `true`,
the value will be changed to false automatically.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element. Use the same name for radio groups

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element.

events.name: checkedChange
events.description:
Emits when the user interacts with the radio-button. Contains `true` in `event.detail`.
This event will only be emitted if the current state of the radio button is false.

cssProperties.name: --ino-radio-active-color
cssProperties.description: color of the radio if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-radio-checked-color
cssProperties.description: color of the radio if checked

cssProperties.name: --ino-radio-disabled-inner-circle-color
cssProperties.description: color of the inner circle if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-radio-disabled-outer-circle-color
cssProperties.description: color of the outer circle if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-radio-hover-color
cssProperties.description: color of the radio on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-radio-unchecked-color
cssProperties.description: color of the radio if unchecked

declarations.name: ino-radio-group.tsx
declarations.description: A wrapper component to be used for a group of ino-radio-buttons. This component manages the single selection functionality of a group of ino-radio-buttons. Due to the shadow DOM implementation of the `ino-radio`-Element the `name`-Property cannot be used to achieve the single selection functionality.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the radio group. If there is an ino-radio-child with the given value, the radio-button will be checked and the other radio-buttons unchecked.

declarations.name: ino-range.tsx
declarations.description:
A range component that allows the user select a number using a slider. It functions as a wrapper around the material [Slider](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-slider) component.

> Note: Range sliders with multiple thumbs are not yet implemented.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme of this component.
Possible values: `primary` (default), `secondary`,
`success`, `warning`, `error`, `light`, `dark`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: discrete
attributes.description: Restricts the slider to only allow discrete values.

attributes.name: markers
attributes.description:
Mark this slider to show the steps of the range.
Only applicable if `discrete=true`

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The max value of this element (**required**).

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The min value of this element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
The step size for this element.
Only applicable if ino-discrete is true.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element. (**unmanaged**, default=`min`)

events.name: valueChange
events.description: Emits when the value changes. Contains new value in `event.detail`.

declarations.name: ino-segment-button.tsx
declarations.description: A button component that can be used in combination with the ino-segment-group component.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Activates the button

attributes.name: dense
attributes.description: Slightly decreases the size of the button

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the button

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the element

events.name: checkedChange
events.description:
Emits if the user interacts with the button.
If the button is disabled or checked, the event will not be emitted.

cssProperties.name: --ino-segment-button-checked-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the segment button if checked

cssProperties.name: --ino-segment-button-checked-shadow
cssProperties.description: Color and shape of the shadow if checked

cssProperties.name: --ino-segment-button-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the segment button if inactive

cssProperties.name: --ino-segment-button-disabled-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the segment button if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-segment-button-hover-color
cssProperties.description: Color of the segment button on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-segment-button-hover-shadow
cssProperties.description: Color and shape of the shadow on hover

declarations.name: ino-segment-group.tsx
declarations.description: A button group that can be used as an alternative to drop-down menus.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the segment group

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the segment group

declarations.name: ino-select.tsx
declarations.description: A component providing single-option select menus. It functions as a wrapper around the material design's [select](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-select) component.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description:
Displays the select as invalid if set to true.
If the property is not set or set to false,
the validation is handled by the default validation.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label of this element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: outline
attributes.description: Styles this select box as outlined element.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Marks this element as required.

attributes.name: show-label-hint
attributes.description:
If true, an *optional* message is displayed if not required,
otherwise a * marker is displayed if required.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element. (**unmanaged**)

events.name: valueChange
events.description: Emits when a selection changes. Contains new value in `event.detail`.

slots.name: icon-leading
slots.description: For the icon to be prepended

cssProperties.name: --ino-select-height
cssProperties.description: Height of the open select menu

cssProperties.name: --ino-select-icon-color
cssProperties.description: Icon color

declarations.name: ino-sidebar.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-sidebar is a modal sidebar that can be used to display additional information.
It functions as a wrapper around the material [drawer](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-drawer/) component.

attributes.name: align-right
attributes.description: Aligns the sidebar to the right (true) or left (false) side

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the component

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Expands the sidebar

events.name: openChange
events.description: Emits an event if the user expands or collapses the sidebar

cssProperties.name: --sidebar-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the open sidebar.

declarations.name: ino-snackbar.tsx
declarations.description: Snackbars provide brief messages about app processes at the bottom of the screen. It functions as a wrapper around the material design's [Snackbar](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-snackbar) component

attributes.name: action-text
attributes.description:
The text to display for the action button.
If no text is defined, the snack bar is displayed in an alternative feedback style.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: The text message to display.

attributes.name: stay-visible-on-hover
attributes.description: If set to true, the timeout that closes the snackbar is paused when the user hovers over the snackbar.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description:
Sets the timeout in ms until the snackbar disappears. The timeout can
be disabled by setting it to a negative value.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Changes the snackbar type

events.name: actionClick
events.description: Event that emits as soon as the action button is clicked.

events.name: hideEl
events.description:
Event that emits as soon as the snackbar hides.
Listen to this event to hide or destroy this element.

cssProperties.name: --ino-snackbar-bottom
cssProperties.description: Distance to the bottom edge

cssProperties.name: --ino-snackbar-left
cssProperties.description: Distance to the left edge

cssProperties.name: --ino-snackbar-right
cssProperties.description: Distance to the right edge

cssProperties.name: --ino-snackbar-top
cssProperties.description: Distance to the top edge

declarations.name: ino-spinner.tsx
declarations.description:
A component which displays a variety of spinners. Use spinners to show that the app is loading content or performing another process for which the user has to wait.

This component contains three different types of spinners animated with pure CSS. It mainly relies on [Spinkit](http://tobiasahlin.com/spinkit/) and may be extended in future with more types.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.
Possible values: `primary` (default),  `secondary`,
`success`, `warning`, `error`, `light`, `dark`.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The height of this spinner (default = 40)

attributes.name: modal
attributes.description: If true, the spinner is shown as modal over the current app page.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of this spinner.
Possible values: `tile` (default), `bounce` or `circle`

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The width of this spinner (defaul = 40)

declarations.name: ino-switch.tsx
declarations.description: Input switches toggle the state of a single item. Compared to the input checkbox, their changes usually apply without any additional submission.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Marks this element as checked. (**unmanaged**)

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.
Possible values: `primary` (default),  `secondary`,
`success`, `warning`, `error`, `light`, `dark`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

events.name: checkedChange
events.description: Emits when the user clicks on the checkbox to change the checked state. Contains the status in `event.detail`.

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-active-color
cssProperties.description: border color of the switch if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-active-thumb-color
cssProperties.description: thumb color of the switch if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-active-track-color
cssProperties.description: track color of the switch if active

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-disabled-color
cssProperties.description: border color of the switch if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-disabled-thumb-color
cssProperties.description: thumb color of the switch if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-disabled-track-color
cssProperties.description: track color of the switch if disabled

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-hover-color
cssProperties.description: border color of the switch on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-hover-thumb-color
cssProperties.description: thumb color of the switch on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-hover-track-color
cssProperties.description: track color of the switch on hover

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-toggled-off-color
cssProperties.description: border color of the switch if toggled off

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-toggled-off-thumb-color
cssProperties.description: thumb color of the switch if toggled off

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-toggled-off-track-color
cssProperties.description: track color of the switch if toggled off

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-toggled-on-color
cssProperties.description: border color of the switch if toggled on

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-toggled-on-thumb-color
cssProperties.description: thumb color of the switch if toggled on

cssProperties.name: --ino-switch-toggled-on-track-color
cssProperties.description: track color of the switch if toggled on

declarations.name: ino-tab.tsx
declarations.description: Tabs organize and allow navigation between groups of content that are related and at the same hierarchical level. Each Tab governs the visibility of one group of content. It functions as a wrapper around the material [Tab](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-tab) component.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Indicates a leading icon in the tab.

attributes.name: indicator-content-width
attributes.description: Indicates that the tab only expands to the width of its content.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Indicates a label text in the tab.

attributes.name: stacked
attributes.description: Indicates that the tab icon and label should flow vertically instead of horizontally.

events.name: interacted
events.description:
Emitted when the user interacts with the tab.
This event is used by the ino-tab-bar.

declarations.name: ino-tab-bar.tsx
declarations.description: Tabs organize and allow navigation between groups of content that are related and at the same hierarchical level. The Tab Bar contains the Tab Scroller and Tab components. It functions as a wrapper around the material [Tab Bar](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-tab-bar) component.

attributes.name: active-tab
attributes.description: Activates the tab at the given index (**unmanaged**).

attributes.name: auto-focus
attributes.description: Autofocus of tab on activation.

events.name: activeTabChange
events.description:
Emits when a tab changes.
Contains the index of the activated tab in `event.detail`

declarations.name: ino-table.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-table is a custom-built data table that can be used to display large sets of data across multiple columns and rows.
The component is based on the mdc-data-table.

declarations.name: ino-table-cell.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-table-cell is a sub-component of the ino-table-row which in turn is a sub-component
of the ino-table. Its main purpose is to add data or header cells to a corresponding data or header row.

attributes.name: numeric
attributes.description: Indicates that the cell contains numeric values

declarations.name: ino-table-row.tsx
declarations.description:
The ino-table-row component is a sub-component of the ino-table and it is mainly used to add additional data or
header rows to the table.

attributes.name: header-row
attributes.description: Indicates that the row is a header row

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Indicates whether the row is selected or not

declarations.name: ino-textarea.tsx
declarations.description:
A textarea component with styles. It uses a material [textfield](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-textfield) component for its styling.

> **Note:** The textarea is always styled in an outlined manner. If you need to use a textarea in combination with other form inputs (`ino-input`), use their respective outline style.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The autofocus of this element.

attributes.name: autogrow
attributes.description:
An optional flag to allow the textarea adjust its height to display all the content.
The `rows` attribute can also be used to specify a minimum height. Use CSS to specify
a max-height for the textarea element. Once the height exceeds the max-height, autogrow
will re-enable the vertical scrollbar.

attributes.name: cols
attributes.description: The number of cols of this textarea.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The optional floating label of this input field.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The max length of this element.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The min length of this element.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of this element.

attributes.name: outline
attributes.description: Styles the input field as outlined element.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The placeholder of this element.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Marks this element as required.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows of this textarea.

attributes.name: show-character-counter
attributes.description: Displays the number of characters. The maxlength-property must be set.

attributes.name: show-label-hint
attributes.description:
If true, an *optional* message is displayed if not required,
otherwise a * marker is displayed if required

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of this element. (**unmanaged**)

events.name: inoBlur
events.description: Emits when the textarea is blurred and validates email input

events.name: valueChange
events.description: Emits when the user types something in. Contains typed input in `event.detail`

cssProperties.name: --ino-textarea-caret-color
cssProperties.description: color of the caret

cssProperties.name: --ino-textarea-label-color
cssProperties.description: color of the label

cssProperties.name: --ino-textarea-outline-color
cssProperties.description: outline color of the textarea

declarations.name: ino-tooltip.tsx
declarations.description:
A tooltip component that displays text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element.

> Note: A tooltip can only display plain text. For more complex dialogs, see the [Popover](https://elements.inovex.de/dist/latest/storybook/?path=/story/notification-ino-popover--default-usage) component.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
Sets the color scheme of the tooltip
Valid options include: 'primary', 'secondary' 'light', 'transparent'

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
The target id the tooltip belongs to.
If not given, the tooltip is attached to the parent component.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text shown in the tooltip.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The placement of the tooltip.
Accepted values: `top(-start, -end)`, `right(-start, -end)`,
`bottom(-start, -end)`, `left(-start, -end)`

attributes.name: trigger

type.text: "click focus mouseenter" | "click focus" | "click mouseenter focus" | "click mouseenter" | "click" | "focus click mouseenter" | "focus click" | "focus mouseenter click" | "focus mouseenter" | "focus" | "mouseenter click focus" | "mouseenter click" | "mouseenter focus click" | "mouseenter focus" | "mouseenter"

attributes.description:
The trigger to show the tooltip - either click, hover or focus.
Multiple triggers possible by separating them with a space.
